intro: Aganope balansae, commonly known as the Balansae aganope, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Aganope balansae is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
